body.p: IAS 27 did not require disclosures relating to interests in unconsolidated entities. The Board was asked by users of financial statements, regulators and others (such as the G20 leaders and the Financial Stability Board) to improve the disclosure requirements for what are often described as ‘off balance sheet’ activities. Unconsolidated structured entities, particularly securitisation vehicles and asset‑backed financings, were identified as forming part of such activities.
